results.title: The French Revolution
results.brief_description: By re-enacting the experiences of M Roget, lawyer and member for the Third Estate, this film offers a brief history of the Revolution, from 1789 to Napoleon. Depicts the calling of the Estates General, formation of the National Assembly of the Third Estate, the discontentment and violence of the Parisian mobs. Follows events leading to The Terror and the final overthrow of the monarchy.

results.title: The French explorers
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Discusses French entry into the age of exploration. Tells of Cartier’s search for the Northwest Passage in 1534, and depicts Champlain’s 1603 expedition to the St. Lawrence River. Also shows the founding of Quebec and immigration of missionaries and traders.

results.title: The Freedom railway
results.brief_description: Looks at the Tan-Zam Railway (known locally as the Freedom Railway) which the Chinese have helped to build in Africa. 14,000 Chinese, working day and night with 40,000 Africans, have pushed this railway 1,900 kilometres from Dar es Salaam on the Indian Ocean to Kapiri Mposhi in the heart of Africa. The film conveys how the Chinese and Africans live, in their work camps, and the relationship which has developed between peoples of such different cultures.

results.title: The Fox and the hound: a lesson in caution
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
This film is a promotional device for the Disney animated feature “The Fox and the hound”. It is a cautionary tale about a young fox named Tod is taken in by an old woman after his mother is killed by a hunter. Full of mischief, young Tod befriends Copper, a hound dog pup. As they grow up, however, their friendship becomes endangered by what they have become - Copper is a hunting dog, and Tod is his prey. Live action written by Philip Abbot who stars as “Uncle Phil.”

results.title: The Forgiving Lord
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Jesus cures the paralytic man; Jesus is welcomed by Matthew and tells the parable of the prodigal son; Peter and Matthew are reconciled; Matthew and Peter leave everything and follow Jesus.

results.title: The Force of gravity [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Our attempt to understand gravitation, especially in its relation to cosmology and geophysics; the views of the Egyptians and the Greeks, the later work of Copernicus, Kepler, Galileo and Newton and modern methods of studying and measuring gravity in different parts of the earth’s surface, with an explanation of the effect of the moon’s gravitational pull on the earth.

results.title: The Foolish frog
results.creator_credit: Gene Deitch, William Bernal and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of a Pete Seeger Folk-song about a farmer who witnesses a bullfrog falling into the mud and makes up a catchy song about it. Soon the whole town is singing it. When the frog hears the popular song about himself he explodes with pride, imparting a valuable lesson to all. Buoyant illustrations seem to dance along the screen.

results.title: The Foolish brother
results.creator_credit: Andrew Grieve, Barry Levinson and Hemisphere Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storybook International”.
Two brothers suddenly obtain a sack of gold coins while Abdul, the foolish brother is out chopping trees. After leaving their village the brothers are attacked by brigands and it is Abdul’s foolishness which saves the day. A Turkish tale. Narrated by Claire Nielson.
